name: Apple___Apple_scab
cause: Fungus Venturia inaequalis. Favors cool, moist conditions.
cure: Apply fungicides such as captan or mancozeb. Remove and destroy infected leaves.

name: Apple___Black_rot
cause: Fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa. Spreads through infected fruit mummies and bark.
cure: Prune infected limbs and use fungicide sprays during early fruit stages.

name: Apple___Cedar_apple_rust
cause: Fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae from nearby juniper trees.
cure: Remove nearby junipers. Apply fungicides like myclobutanil or mancozeb.

name: Apple___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Maintain good air circulation and regular pruning.

name: Blueberry___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Continue good watering and sunlight exposure.

name: Cherry___Powdery_mildew
cause: Fungus Podosphaera clandestina. White powdery growth on leaves.
cure: Use sulfur-based sprays or neem oil. Prune to increase airflow.

name: Cherry___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Keep soil well-drained and maintain balanced fertilization.

name: Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_leaf_spot
cause: Fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis. Favored by humid conditions.
cure: Use resistant hybrids. Rotate crops and apply fungicides if needed.

name: Corn___Common_rust
cause: Fungus Puccinia sorghi. Develops in moderate temperature and moisture.
cure: Use resistant hybrids. Apply fungicides early in infection.

name: Corn___Northern_Leaf_Blight
cause: Fungus Exserohilum turcicum causes cigar-shaped lesions.
cure: Use resistant varieties and crop rotation.

name: Corn___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Maintain balanced fertilization and proper spacing.

name: Grape___Black_rot
cause: Fungus Guignardia bidwellii. Appears as black spots on leaves and fruit.
cure: Use fungicides and remove mummified fruits.

name: Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles)
cause: Fungal complex infection, usually in older vines.
cure: Prune infected wood and disinfect tools. Avoid water stress.

name: Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot)
cause: Fungus Pseudocercospora vitis causing brown leaf lesions.
cure: Spray with copper-based fungicides. Remove infected debris.

name: Grape___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Maintain proper pruning and nutrient balance.

name: Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening)
cause: Bacterium Candidatus Liberibacter asiaticus transmitted by psyllids.
cure: Remove infected trees. Control psyllids with neem or insecticides.

name: Peach___Bacterial_spot
cause: Bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. pruni.
cure: Apply copper-based bactericides. Remove infected twigs.

name: Peach___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Regular pruning and nutrient management.

name: Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot
cause: Bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria.
cure: Use copper sprays and resistant varieties.

name: Pepper,_bell___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Maintain good field hygiene and regular watering.

name: Potato___Early_blight
cause: Fungus Alternaria solani. Brown concentric spots on older leaves.
cure: Use fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb.

name: Potato___Late_blight
cause: Fungus Phytophthora infestans. Causes rotting and leaf necrosis.
cure: Remove infected plants and use copper-based sprays.

name: Potato___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Ensure proper drainage and avoid overwatering.

name: Raspberry___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Maintain good airflow and remove old canes.

name: Soybean___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Use disease-free seeds and rotate crops.

name: Squash___Powdery_mildew
cause: Fungus Podosphaera xanthii. White coating on leaves.
cure: Use sulfur sprays or potassium bicarbonate. Remove infected leaves.

name: Strawberry___Leaf_scorch
cause: Fungus Diplocarpon earliana causing brown leaf edges.
cure: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicide as needed.

name: Strawberry___healthy
cause: No disease detected.

name: Tomato___Bacterial_spot
cause: Bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria.
cure: Use copper sprays and disease-free seeds.

name: Tomato___Early_blight
cause: Fungus Alternaria solani. Common in warm, wet conditions.
cure: Apply chlorothalonil or copper fungicides. Rotate crops annually.

name: Tomato___Late_blight
cause: Fungus Phytophthora infestans. Causes grey mold and fruit rot.
cure: Remove infected plants and spray mancozeb or copper hydroxide.

name: Tomato___Leaf_Mold
cause: Fungus Passalora fulva. Yellow spots turning brown underneath leaves.
cure: Improve ventilation and apply fungicides.

name: Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot
cause: Fungus Septoria lycopersici.
cure: Remove infected leaves and use fungicides like chlorothalonil.

name: Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_mite
cause: Tiny mites feeding on plant sap under dry, hot conditions.
cure: Spray neem oil or miticides. Increase humidity.

name: Tomato___Target_Spot
cause: Fungus Corynespora cassiicola causes circular brown lesions.
cure: Use resistant varieties and fungicide treatment.

name: Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus
cause: Whitefly-transmitted virus causing leaf curling and yellowing.
cure: Use resistant varieties and control whiteflies with insecticidal soap.

name: Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus
cause: Virus spread by contact with infected plants or tools.
cure: Remove infected plants. Disinfect tools with bleach solution.

name: Tomato___healthy
cause: No disease detected.
cure: Maintain balanced fertilizer and proper watering.
